template.template: Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk average queue size (avgqu-sz)
item_prototype.description: Current average disk queue, the number of requests outstanding on the disk at the time the performance data is collected.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read request avg waiting time (r_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: r/s. The number (after merges) of read requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total read time counter. Used in r_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk utilization
item_prototype.description: This item is the percentage of elapsed time that the selected disk drive was busy servicing read or writes requests.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write request avg waiting time (w_await)
item_prototype.description: This formula contains two boolean expressions that evaluates to 1 or 0 in order to set calculated metric to zero and to avoid division by zero exception.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: w/s. The number (after merges) of write requests completed per second for the device.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write time (rate)
item_prototype.description: Rate of total write time counter. Used in w_await calculation

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Get stats
item_prototype.description: Get contents of /sys/block/{#DEVNAME}/stat for disk stats.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active:vfs.dev.read.await[{#DEVNAME}].min(15m)} > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} or {Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active:vfs.dev.write.await[{#DEVNAME}].min(15m)} > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high (read > {$VFS.DEV.READ.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m or write > {$VFS.DEV.WRITE.AWAIT.WARN:"{#DEVNAME}"} ms for 15m)
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

item.host: Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active
Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active
Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active
Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active
Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active
Template Module Linux block devices by Zabbix agent active

macro.description: This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
Disk read average response time (in ms) before the trigger would fire
Disk write average response time (in ms) before the trigger would fire

template.template: Template Module Linux CPU by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template Module Linux CPU by Zabbix agent active

item.name: CPU utilization
item.description: CPU utilization in %.

trigger.name: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger.description: CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

dependency.name: Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel).

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system).

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

macro.description: Load per CPU considered sustainable. Tune if needed.

template.template: Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: It may become impossible to write to disk if there are no index nodes left. As symptoms, 'No space left on device' or 'Disk is full' errors may be seen even though free space is available.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Running out of free inodes (free < {$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.inode[{#FSNAME},pfree].min(5m)}<{$VFS.FS.INODE.PFREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} or {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"} or {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)
trigger_prototype.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: Two conditions should match: First, space utilization should be above {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. Second condition should be one of the following: - The disk free space is less than {$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.WARN:"{#FSNAME}"}. - The disk will be full in less than 24 hours.

dependency.name: {#FSNAME}: Disk space is critically low (used > {$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"}%)
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].last()}>{$VFS.FS.PUSED.MAX.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} and (({Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},total].last()}-{Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},used].last()})<{$VFS.FS.FREE.MIN.CRIT:"{#FSNAME}"} or {Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active:vfs.fs.size[{#FSNAME},pused].timeleft(1h,,100)}<1d)

item.host: Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active
Template Module Linux filesystems by Zabbix agent active

macro.description: The critical threshold of the filesystem utilization.
The warning threshold of the filesystem utilization.
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in filesystems discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level

template.template: Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active

item.name: Maximum number of open file descriptors
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: Configured max number of open filedescriptors is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXFILES.MIN})

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

trigger.name: Configured max number of processes is too low (< {$KERNEL.MAXPROC.MIN})

dependency.name: Getting closer to process limit (over 80% used)
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:proc.num.last()}/{Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>80

item.name: System name
item.description: System host name.

trigger.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: System name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: System local time
item.description: System local time of the host.

trigger.name: System time is out of sync (diff with Zabbix server > {$SYSTEM.FUZZYTIME.MAX}s)
trigger.description: The host system time is different from the Zabbix server time.

item.name: Operating system architecture
item.description: Operating system architecture of the host.

trigger.name: Operating system description has changed
trigger.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Ack to close.

dependency.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:system.hostname.diff()}=1 and {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:system.hostname.strlen()}>0

item.name: System description
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: System uptime
item.description: System uptime in 'N days, hh:mm:ss' format.

trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} has been restarted (uptime < 10m)
trigger.description: The host uptime is less than 10 minutes

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

dependency.name: Operating system description has changed
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:system.sw.os.diff()}=1 and {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:system.sw.os.strlen()}>0

dependency.name: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:system.hostname.diff()}=1 and {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:system.hostname.strlen()}>0

template.template: Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active

item.name: Free swap space
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: Free swap space in %
item.description: The free space of swap volume/file in percent.

item.name: Total swap space
item.description: The total space of swap volume/file in bytes.

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory, in Linux, available = free + buffers + cache. On other platforms calculation may vary. See also Appendixes in Zabbix Documentation about parameters of the vm.memory.size item.

item.name: Available memory in %
item.description: Available memory as percentage of total. See also Appendixes in Zabbix Documentation about parameters of the vm.memory.size item.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: Total memory in Bytes.

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Memory used percentage is calculated as (100-pavailable)

trigger.name: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The system is running out of free memory.

dependency.name: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.size[available].max(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0

macro.description: This macro is used as a threshold in memory available trigger.
This macro is used as a threshold in memory utilization trigger.

template.template: Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Speed
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface latest or current speed value. Value is an integer representing the link speed in bits/sec. This attribute is only valid for interfaces that implement the ethtool get_link_ksettings method (mostly Ethernet). Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Interface type
item_prototype.description: Indicates the interface protocol type as a decimal value. See include/uapi/linux/if_arp.h for all possible values. Reference: https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/ABI/testing/sysfs-class-net

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].change()}<0 and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].last()}>0 and ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}=6 or {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/type"].last()}=1) and ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].change()}>0 and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].prev()}>0) or ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)
dependency.recovery_expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].last()} or {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].last()}) and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].last()} and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}"].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/speed"].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: High bandwidth usage (>{$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}%)
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)
dependency.recovery_expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.in["{#IFNAME}",errors].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:net.if.out["{#IFNAME}",errors].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: High error rate (>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}: Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}=2 and {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].diff()}=1)
dependency.recovery_expression: {Template Module Linux network interfaces by Zabbix agent active:vfs.file.contents["/sys/class/net/{#IFNAME}/operstate"].last()}<>2 or {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=0

template.template: Template OS Linux by Zabbix agent active
template.name: Template OS Linux by Zabbix agent active
template.description:
Official Linux template. Requires agent of Zabbix 3.0.14, 3.4.5 and 4.0.0 or newer.
Known Issues:
Description: Network discovery. Zabbix agent as of 4.2 doesn't support items such as net.if.status, net.if.speed.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/387225-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-template-for-linux
Template tooling version used: 0.39

trigger.expression: {Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:proc.num.last()}/{Template Module Linux generic by Zabbix agent active:kernel.maxproc.last()}*100>80
trigger.name: Getting closer to process limit (over 80% used)

trigger.expression: {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:system.swap.size[,pfree].max(5m)}<{$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN} and {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:system.swap.size[,total].last()}>0
trigger.name: High swap space usage (less than {$SWAP.PFREE.MIN.WARN}% free)
trigger.description: This trigger is ignored, if there is no swap configured.

dependency.name: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.utilization.min(5m)}>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}

dependency.name: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
dependency.expression: {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.size[available].max(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0

trigger.expression: {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.size[available].max(5m)}<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} and {Template Module Linux memory by Zabbix agent active:vm.memory.size[total].last()}>0
trigger.name: Lack of available memory (<{$MEMORY.AVAILABLE.MIN} of {ITEM.VALUE2})
Load average is too high (per CPU load over {$LOAD_AVG_PER_CPU.MAX.WARN} for 5m)
trigger.description: Per CPU load average is too high. Your system may be slow to respond.
